nodes.bodyText: Can you remove this file please? It's not needed
Well, that's the reason it fails :) This is the first page it checks to make sure it started. Otherwise, you need to be checking the hello endpoint.
Better to check the hello endpoint I would say instead of this useless file :)
I assume this comment can go away :)
This was copied as it is from basic-multi-module-project template, but I'll remove it
I assume this change along with the one AppModelGradleResolver have been vetted by @aloubyansky ?
Yes, he was guiding me throughout this so most probably
"jandex" should not be replacing "processResources" here. There should be an additional if block for "jandex".

The last two lines should be removed from this file. These versions will be injected as part of the test setup. We can't be mentioning any version in here otherwise the release process (changing the versions) will fail.
This one is checking the content of the index.html. Which you can remove given that you removed the index.xml.
The idea behind removing this assert statement is to straightaway check for the /hello endpoint right ?
The idea is that the application no longer serves the index.html and it suffices to just check /hello - checking the contents of index.html doesn't provide anything useful to this test
This change should now move to https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/devtools/gradle/src/main/java/io/quarkus/gradle/builder/QuarkusModelBuilder.java#L285
